appDescriptionLong.>:
Enriches the built-in media viewer with different customization possibilities and functionality.

Features:
- Default sizing modes and switching between them via shortcuts or with mouse clicks
- Custom CSS (background color for the page or media, hidden scrollbars...)
- Custom information about the media in the tab title
- Floating menu (mouse cursor over the top-left)
- Mouse wheel zooming (off by default)
- Centering content (default)
- Rotate/Flip (via shortcuts or from the menu)
- Sending the address of the media to different services (such as reverse image search)
- Frame extraction for animated images (GIF, APNG, WEBP)
- Handling SVG and data:URIs
- Forced inlining (show media instead of download)
- Native DASH, HLS, MSS streaming (if the browser can support it)
- Customizable media attributes (autoplay, loop, controls, mute, volume)
- Opening images from regular web-pages with right long-press or with shortcut (off by default)

Check out the Options page for more details.
appDescriptionLong.?:
A longer description for the official extension repositories.
Should be plain text, without any formatting elements (HTML, Markdown...).

appDescriptionShort.>: Additional functionality for the browser's built-in media viewer.
appDescriptionShort.?:
A short description that appears in the extension manager.
Should be plain text, without any formatting elements (HTML, Markdown...).

options.?: Every string that can be found on the Options page

clickOverDoc.>: Allow clicks over the whole page

customCssTextareaPh.>:
Change the background color, image border/shadow, and hide the scrollbars or the floating menu...
Hover the question mark to see examples, use the color picker above for getting color codes.

customCssTip.>: body { background: #f3f3f5; /* Any valid background property (color, url(), gradient...). */ overflow: hidden; /* Hides the scrollbars. To show them, change "hidden" to "auto". */ } #media { background: #eef; /* Different background for the image. */ border: 10px solid white; /* Image border. */ box-shadow: 0 0 10px grey; /* Shadow of the image. */ cursor: default !important; /* Don't allow the mouse cursor to change. */ } /* Color of the free-zoom mask. */ .mask { color: rgba(0, 0, 0, .4); } /* Disable the menu. */ #menu { display: none; } /* Always show the menu. */ #menu { display: block; } /* Other menu positions: */ #menu { top: auto; bottom: 0; } /* bottom left */ #menu { left: auto; right: 0; } /* top right */ #menu { top: auto; left: auto; right: 0; bottom: 0; } /* bottom right */ /* Horizontal menu */ #menu > ul { flex-direction: row; }

faviconTip.>: This option allows to set a custom tab-icon for the opened image. The address of the image can be used as a variable: %url

forceInlineMedia.>: Force media inlining instead of download

mediaAttributesTip.>: Acceptable attributes autoplay - video starts automatically loop - repeat the play controls - show player controls muted - mute sound volume=0-100 - default volume (%)

mediaInfoTip.>: Display custom information in the title of the tab. It may contain the following variables: %ow - original width %oh - original height %ratio - current width / current height %w - current width %h - current height %perc - percent of the original size %url - full URL %name - filename %size - formatted filesize (may not work)

minUpscaleTip.>:
Normally, smaller images won't be upscaled to the view-port. This option forces them to do so.
The value is given in percent, and tells the script to enlarge those images that are larger than the given percent of view-port's width or height (it depends on the previous option).

permisssionWarning.>: The following options require optional permissions:

scCycleModes.>: Cycle sizing modes: natural, fit to width, fit to height

scDragndrop.>: Hold Ctrl or Alt to drag the image if that doesn't fit the view-port

scFloatMenu.>: Move the cursor to the top left edge of the page to show the menu

scFreeZoom.>: Shift + drag on the image to use free-zoom, hold Ctrl to move the selection

scHorizontalScroll.>: To scroll the image horizontally, use the mouse wheel over the left bottom edge

scImgBg.>: Cycle image backgrounds: default, black, white, check, or hold Shift for custom value

scReset.>: Esc will reset the image to its original form, or quits from free-zoom

wheelZoomWithKey.>: Zoom with mouse wheel with key

zoomParamsTip.>: Format: step; snap1 snap2 snap3 step - zoom-in percent (from the actual size image) divided by 100 (e.g., 0.3 - 30%, so the zoomed-in image will be 130% of the current image). snaps (minimum two values, separated by white-space) - different scales of the original size (e.g., 0.25 0.5 0.75 1 1.5 - these scales will be used from 25% to 150%, outside this range step is used). Holding Alt or Shift while zooming will ignore the snap points.
